data.title: listen
data.meta_description: CAMP - Residential arts and music courses high in the French Pyrenees, with Chris Watson, Anne Bean, Christina Kubisch, Laure Prouvost, Gavin Bryars, Laraaji, Eli Keszler and others
data.text:
A different kind of Present is an argument against the search for the perfect memory, borrowed and imagined fragments become sonic narratives, elaborate and unstable fabrications of delicate folds in time. A bi-monthly show where invited artists weave sonic apparitions, small epiphanies and recollections.

LOADING

These programs emerged from the creative residency that brought together 3 brazilians sound artists - Thelmo Cristovam (BR), EdBrass Brasil(BR), Rodrigo Ramos (BR) and Dave Phillips (CH), from the sound material captured in 2006 by Thelmo Cristovam and in 2011 by Dave Phillips, both in the Amazon rainforest.

LOADING

A show dedicated to music in the margins - lost, obscure albums and tracks from the past plus new music by a plethora of underground artists.

LOADING

Mel O’Dubhslaine and Phil Todd from Ashtray Navigations present music currently floating the boat at Ashtray HQ. Mostly from crackly old records to satisfy your analogue itch. Rarities, oddities and obscurities from across the musical spectrum. http://ashtraynavigations.wordpress.com

LOADING

Mel O’Dubhslaine and Phil Todd from Ashtray Navigations present music currently floating the boat at Ashtray HQ. Mostly from crackly old records to satisfy your analogue itch. Rarities, oddities and obscurities from across the musical spectrum.

LOADING

A project led by Matthew Byars of DC band The Caribbean. Influenced by the work of Mission of Burma soundman Martin Swope, who captured and loops elements of the band’s sound, Byars has players (different ones every time) generate improvised sound through his board, which he captures, loops, and destroys.

LOADING

A collage of collected and received recordings, an immersive audio experience consisting of submissions by musicians associated with the Audio. Visuals. Atmosphere. label. An hour of music that can’t be heard anywhere else; unfinished pieces, sketches, failed experiments, field recordings, loops, audio diaries, and more…

LOADING

L.A. Musician/Producer Lola G. aka Death Hags plays new releases, outtakes and WIP tracks from her BIG GREY SUN project as well as music from artists that have influenced her.

LOADING

A monthly radio show curated by Mally Harpaz. Playing music from the wonderful artists who featured on Blind Dog Studio Presents events and simply anything that inspired me over the years.

LOADING

Blind Head Recordings is a record label focusing on outsider, sound art and experimental music. A record label for people with decision anxiety. "Blind Head Presents:" showcases the label's new releases, as well as occasional discussions with the artists.

LOADING

Bradford Sound Artists is a loose collective of sound artists from in and around the Bradford district. The radio show is a way to share sound and music that we find interesting with an audience that might be equally curious.

LOADING

SURFING ON VAPOUR WAVES HIGH FROM THE EARTH BUT WITH BOTH FEET PLANTED DEEP DEEP DOWN - A RETURN TO THE FUTURE. WEEKLY ORGY OF COSMIC CLASSIX OLD 'N' NU. BROADCAST FROM FULL ASHRAM CELESTIAL GARDEN. YOU ARE INVITED. FREE LOVE IS: S & L COOK SEVERAL TIME LOSERS OF THE SCOTTISH ALBUM OF THE YEAR AWARD - LEADERS OF YOGIC CULT, THIRD EAR - TRANSMUTERS OF PURE COSMIC NRG - EDUCATORS, INSPIRATORS, AND MASTURBATORS - OF THIS WORLD AND THE NEXT.

LOADING

Chinabot is a platform and collective created to change the dialogue surrounding Asian music. We are positioned at the junction point between the influence of Asian music on contemporary/traditional sounds, music outside the mainstream and the development of experimentation.

LOADING

You have reached the staff radio station of Clay Industries, R&D department. These sounds are purely for recreational use, and do not form part of Clay Industries mining strategy. This month's experiments maintained by Ross Hughes, Thomas Haines and Pascal Wyse. Includes guest demonstration by Adrian Corker, assisted by Pascal Wyse on trombone

LOADING

“Departures” is a radio show by sound artist Nhung Nguyen, exploring the theme of departure and change through a series of carefully curated experimental and sound art mix. List of artists and tracks to be announced.

LOADING

Shape-shifting genre-spanning tracks which are tasty in all sorts of ways. Tends to be on the heavy ear candy end of techno, leftfield techno, deconstructed club, break beat and drum & bass but includes surprises and spans genres, which as Mad Miran says, are for journalists anyway.

LOADING

Dragon's Eye Recordings is a digital imprint focusing on elevating marginalized voices in experimental music. Each month our show will feature a guest mix from an artist on our roster.

LOADING

Diverse blend of ambient, techno, and everything in between. The show isn't just about the music; it's a platform for engaging conversations and interviews centered around the world of sound and rhythm.

LOADING

We talk to artists and other creators about the three songs that changed the course of their creative lives, or their lives in general.

LOADING

CONNECTIVE SOUND TISSUE OR A FLOATING ORB WHICH EVERYONE CAN SEE AND CLIMB INSIDE. ONE EAR CONNECTED TO EVERY EAR IN THE WORLD. A GOD EAR. A TUNNEL PUSHING SOUND THROUGH EARTH. NOT REALLY SURE IF IT'S A TUNNEL OR AN ORB. YOU FUCKING WORK IT OUT.

LOADING

Hello and welcome to Fouter and Swick, my show for CAMP Radio where I'll be playing all sorts of experimental music both old and new. With James Wyness.

LOADING

"Human was the music, natural was the static." "In Silico" is a sixty minute journey through the multifaceted chaos and calm of electronic music. Curated by Fragile X every fourth Sunday.

LOADING

A group of radio artists at Camp FR's 'Free Radio Pyrenees' residency, led by Andrew O' Connor and Magz Hall, created three compositions. Using micro-receivers broadcasting on 99.1FM, they crafted site-specific pieces through collaborative efforts, incorporating field recordings, research, poetry, and shared experiences. The tracks form a route through Aulus les Bains, interacting as listeners move between receivers.

LOADING

Music, songs, words, sounds, symphonies and anthems from the uncanny slopes of Bonfire Hill. An aural almanac. A musical guide to the rituals, seasons, rhythms, celebrations and darkling nights when the veil is thin.

LOADING

Sonic explorations by Graham Dowdall, aka Gagarin. This features lots of stuff close to me including some material from forthcoming Phenomenology EP and some recent remixes and other material close to my heart.

LOADING

Dark, weird, sweet and salty; like a hell-broth boil and bubble, this is a show of sonic sorcery from near and far.

LOADING

holding hands is an octet co-led by trumpeter Chris Dowding and saxophonist Rob Milne, featuring exciting UK improvisers including saxophonist Dee Byrne and vibraphonist Martin Pyne, Their new ‘social butterfly EP’ will be released in April 2022 and this radio show explores some of the influences behind the octet.

LOADING

Collections of songs, pieces and soundscapes interwoven by melodicism. Fluctuating between rawness and precision, melancholy and exaltation, quietude and amplitude, it brings together different genres, places, and modes of sonic and emotional attunement.

LOADING

Exploring the music that inspired and was produced by the Fluxus group and related artists, and those who came after. Presented by Bill Vine.

LOADING

Music for answerphone messages from the 1990s. Get a look into a world and a City far removed from now, where people communicated via messages on tapes and called from phone boxes. Along the way Neneh Cherry, Steve Strange, The Neville Brothers and MTV all get mentioned. Young people trying to make something happen! All soundtracked by some out there Beach Ready sounds that veer from drone/ambient to 90s R and B pastiche to easy listening. Hyper reality!

LOADING

By GX Jupitter-Larsen, with special thanks to Tristan Koreya, Gwendolyn Pogrowski, Dave Phillips, Lala Lu, and Andy Bolus. GX Jupitter-Larsen is currently based in Los Angeles. Since 1979, he has worked as a performance artist, sound artist, writer, and filmmaker.

LOADING

Torture and the Desert Spiders/Kill The Radio monthly show spotlighting RnR, blues and whatever hits our ears from all over the world. Grooving different each week. Here is the jumping point, now sit back n learn the lyrics, air drum the tunes and fall in love with music each month.

LOADING

We share our live show recorded in Sweden last year and premier a new track with some stories behind it

LOADING

The monthly radio show presented by founder/organizer Marlo De Lara, features new sounds from experimental/fringe/noise/sound artists/musicians who are women and other marginalized communities as well as celebrating past contributors of the LIN compilations. www.corpuscallosumdistro.com

LOADING

personal mixtape of whatever is lying around the stereo at liquid library HQ (charlie's living room). Might have some chat or whatever, too. You'll probably get some unrelease/live/work-in-progress stuff from us and our orbit as well. Fuck tories.

LOADING

A dreamy mix of moody, emotive, ambient, experimental and downtempo music peppered with new releases. Curated by Karen Vogt. Fortnightly show from 2 - 5pm CEST with a guest musician mix in the second hour of the show. Let's get lost...

LOADING

An extra hour of dreamy mix of moody, emotive, ambient, experimental and downtempo music. Curated by Karen Vogt. Fortnightly show from 2 - 5pm CEST with a guest musician mix in the second hour of the show. Let's get lost...

LOADING

Join Gayle Brogan (Pefkin / Burd Ellen) as she opens up her cabinet of curiosities. New and old releases, a deep dive into the archive of '00s cdr releases, moth of the month, Pefkin-made idents and more!

LOADING

MODULISME is a new media supporting leftfield MODULAR SYNTHESIS. A radio program, magazine, and above all label-like offering music for you to listen to. All archived shows are only available on Mixcloud for 2 weeks. Visit us at Modulisme for all compositions. Each program lasts 2 hours & is dedicated to 2 composers. The voice is Ben Edwards (aka Benge) and A&R by Philippe Petit who originated the platform.

LOADING

The sounds that can be heard here at morc hq: mostly slow, organic, quiet and repetitive songs/drones, with the occasional exception thrown in for your own good. you might hear an exclusive live recording or unreleased track as well.

LOADING

A joyride round the outer rims of music history, with an eclectic grab-bag of records played in chronological order by Blue Tapes’ David McNamee. Every month, over the course of 1 hour, you can actually hear music EVOLVE.

LOADING

A small collective of idiots who sell records online from a light industrial paradise in Holbeck, Leeds. The show veers between the disparate tastes of its disagreeable employees who protest too much that they don't really like music anymore; secretly they love it and will argue with you about Can.

LOADING

A one hour bi-weekly show during which rikardfvs plays a mix of new sounds made by experimental-ambient artists and noise artists from around the world.

LOADING

A third world. An imaginary atlas of sound, color, and history. Composer and writer Ross Devlin explores links between experimental and avant garde music in different times and places. Modern works will be compared to their predecessors, international influence will be discussed, obscure and new music pieces played in their entirety with witty commentary.

LOADING

A listening diary that collects experimental, electronic, popular song, field recordings, and other aural experiences into bi-monthly capsules of programming. If an ear worm planted a garden, this is what has been harvested from the crop.

LOADING

Mia Zabelka is an Austrian musician and composer known for her experimental use of the violin and electronic music, incorporating elements of noise, drone, and improvisation into her compositions. Mia Zabelka founded the Klanghaus Untergreith, an international center for sound art in the Austrian region of South Styria. It hosts the Klangzeit festival four times a year. In cooperation with Klanghaus Untergreith phonoECHOES presents sound art and experimental music of the Klangzeit festival.

LOADING

The music is primarily from plants and fungi. The biodata information captured is used to map out the work. Music with cadences, pitches and tempo that derive from a non human origin. They feed us, create the environment we live in....they make us safe...Time to listen.

LOADING

A themed musical journey. Over two hours, each episode will take you on an in-depth spelunk through an obscure genre, fancifully imagine connections between disparate musical styles, or ride the connected paths through an artist and their side-projects and collaborations.

LOADING

Mark Waldron-Hyden shares the sonic findings of his sound art experiments as well as the music that inspires them, exploring the role nature plays in music new and old

LOADING

Every month dive into a different scene or genre with a distant sing-along, with poetic reflections layered in. A collage of music where the listener's participation is felt. https://www.instagram.com/odiejighast/

LOADING

A railroad track designed with tight fuzz turns, steep feedback slopes, and sometimes reverb inversions. A loud journey to discover new psych, noise, kraut and shoegaze bands from around the globe. The speakers will be shoegaze musicians themselves, coming off bands of In a State of Flux (a collective and touring festival devoted to the growing Italogaze scene)

LOADING

The "Sam Lou Uncased Podcast" features independent and nomadic songwriters in conversation with Sam Lou Talbot through the storying of musical lives. To be featured, get in touch at samloutalbot@gmail.com Instagram: @samloutalbotmusic Twitter: @samloutalbot

LOADING

The two members of Star Turbine presents some of their favourie music (1958 - 2017) as well as a few tastes of their own

LOADING

an immersive listening experience consisting of all kinds of music, sketches, field recordings, movies dialogues, audio diaries and much more. every sound that can exist (and perhaps even those that do not exist). at 70% lofi. to listen. to slow down. to listen. with Marie Rose.

LOADING

You've heard of a gaggle of geese. You've heard of a charm of starlings. Well, "Snog, Marry, The Void" is a parliament of depressed, gobby pricks. Together they will bring you something old, something new, something half-inched and turn the air blue. Two hours of silver-tongued patter accompanied by some weird sounds. Once a month. Just like your dad.

LOADING

Sonic forma are shifting sound scans that shape Syntax Erika. Sound and structure; Signal and signs, all that can be sonically explored in electronics is here. A hybrid mixtapes episodes for her residency. Where she mixes natural sounds with synthetic noises.

LOADING

Snows Ov Gethen & Tarotplane present "Sonology". An exploration of sound within a diverse but coherent spectrum. The aim is to build a certain sense of narrative. One that looks to tell a story while at the same time exploring the connections between genres

LOADING

This episode... music from Hreám Recordings and Wormhole World. An eclectic mix of ambient, electronic and experimental music from these two great labels. The latest SEODAH release was a collabration with them. Sound Effects Of... is a personal journey through musical history to uncover the links and influences that cross genres and times.

LOADING

Greta Thunberg tells us our world is breaking. Ecosystems are collapsing, our house is burning. According to Terry Tempest Williams, we can fix it like a mosaic, sticking it back together piece by piece. So here is a soundtrack for the recovery process.

LOADING

The Rock Garden of Chandigarh are an improv band who create soundtracks for films, situations and feelings. Once a month we invite you to step into a new reality and travel the full range of human experience through the medium of soundtrack experiences, drawn from film, TV, games, art, books and the imagination. Close your eyes and join the journey. rockgardenofchandigarh@gmail.com

LOADING

Sounds of India is the new show by India-based label, ONNO Collective. The show is an investigation into the unique music + sound practices that occur throughout the country. Each episode features a new musician as they showcase their sounds in a one-hour, no-holds-barred live show.

LOADING

A monthly show with music that moves or inspires me. Or just makes me laugh or cry, or all of the above.

LOADING

TECHNOPOIESIS, a live concert with analogue improvisation as well as AI composition, was held 12-13 May 2023 at Fylkingen, Stockholm. It presented performances by Mark Buckeridge, John Macormac + Robin Price, Muiredach O’Riain and Quantum Foam, exploring forms of poetic tensions and possibilities in the machine age.

LOADING

The Asynchronous Drone Orchestra[s] is a remote collaborative project where different electronic musicians are asked to share one (or more) ten minutes sound - be it a drone, a field recording, or a more elaborate soundscape - following a minimal set of rules. All those fragments and noises are then mixed and combined in a long and coherent track, resulting in a choral soundscape where the result is bigger than the sum of its parts.

LOADING

Adventurous and diverse music curated by Manchester label Efpi Records, presented by a rotating line-up of artists working across all areas of jazz, improvised and experimental music. Expect to hear anything and everything: bebop, electropop, classical, metal, folk, hip-hop… who knows? This week's show is hosted by Efpi boss & conductor, composer, arranger, and producer Ben Cottrell. https://twitter.com/_bencottrell https://www.bencottrell.com

LOADING

I have a huge love of all genres of music! I love to take the listener on their own personal sonic journey. Perfect for that long train ride where you can enjoy the scenery with a cinematic sound track.

LOADING

A journey into artist David Breather’s musical universe. Exploring his own music projects, collaborators, influences, and respected artists from throughout his life as a music fanatic and creator. An eclectic mix of content in a wide range of genres and forms. From the borders of the mainstream to the fringes of the avant-garde and the spaces in-between.

LOADING

On this month's show we've got thrilling rock music from around the solar system, free thinking dub from Ganymede, Far Side lunar hip hop and a beautiful asteroid belt love song. Whatever your orbit we have the sounds you need to hear.

LOADING

The Townsend Brown Works,is a deep listening retrospective of Coagulant's work from 2018 to 2020. It is abstract sound, not music. For full enjoyment,it is recommended to listen in the dark. Lie down, close your eyes and connect to your ideal dimension. Magick is imagination, imagination is magick.

LOADING

Pie Are Squared obsesses over a sound, genre, label, artist, or movement for a month and distils it into an hour long mix. For the faint of heart.

LOADING

What is it about music that makes you buzz? In that track you love the most.. what draws you in? What tugs on your heartstrings, makes you dance? This show will discuss just this! Talking about the music itself, what makes the sound of the music appealing to you?

LOADING

Breakneck Eclecticism - A thematic celebration of sounds that straddle discipline and genre, join us as we unbox some audio delights! For 2022, each show will focus on the unique qualities of the month of its release: the sights, emotions, textures, stories and colours of the changing year.

LOADING

Sink into shifting sands of sound, let the oasis fling you up and around. Using noises from anything and everything, Australian sound artist Alexis Weaver brings you an hour of ambient acousmatic soundscapes and field recordings.

LOADING

A soundscape collage from my project “Sound Path”, based on field recording of several Italian cities and towns: 1) Suno (Piedmont) 00.00/06.39 2) Massa_Lombarda (Emilia_Romagna) 06.39/13.36 3) Ariccia (Lazio) 13.36/19.53 4) Nemi (Lazio) 19.53/29.20 5) Pomezia (Lazio) 29.20/33.56 6) Firenze (Tuscany) 33.56/45.25 7) Pisa (Tuscany) 45.25/51.09 8) Ancona (Marche) 51.09/59.47

LOADING

Actually the best damn radio show you ever heard, according to all the youth of today. Classics, new stuff and fun in saunas.

LOADING

This month's show serves as a soundtrack to the colder months as we enter hibernation. A dedication in solidarity to those who're enduring S.A.D right now... No talking from NikNak this time, just a soundscape-ish selection of tracks to accompany you on a winter hike, or cozy up under a thick blanket with some tea and listen to... Enjoy!

LOADING

ℝℯ∀DiN𝕘 excerpts from The Gates Between {Elizabeth Stuart Phelps} / Before the Thunderstorm {Elena Firsova} / Piano Potpourri: Soliloquy & Rhapsody {Zenobia Powell Perry} / Processional {Faye-Ellen Silverman} / Caprice {Kay Gardner & Mary Watkins} / Five Movements In Color {Mary D. Watkins} / Passacaglia On An Old English Tune {Rebecca Clarke} / Piano Trio: I. Moderato ma appassionato {Rebecca Clarke} / Tableaux de Provence {Paule Maurice} / Many thanks to Project Gutenberg

LOADING

A commemorative show for my grandmother, who died 10 years ago this year, featuring two versions of the piece ‘you can hear me’, commissioned originally by Durham Brass Festival. The show also features songs written about my grandmothers’ work during WW2, including the band Natural Causes. Tune in..!

LOADING
